private_information: I am allowed to move disks: A, B, C, D, E
I can only move one disk at a time
I must not place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves (in order) for disks A B C D E so the global goal configuration is reached, providing moves in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'

private_information: I am allowed to move disks: F, G, H, I, J
I can only move one disk at a time
I must not place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves (in order) for disks F G H I J so the global goal configuration is reached, providing moves in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'

private_information: I am allowed to move disks: K, L, M, N, O
I can only move one disk at a time
I must not place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves (in order) for disks K L M N O so the global goal configuration is reached, providing moves in the format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'

private_information: I coordinate the three agents and integrate their move sequences
I must produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownward solver
I must keep agent actions distinct in the PDDL representation
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent move sequences and output a PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted to FastDownward that represents the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi and achieves the goal configuration

public_information: Classic Tower of Hanoi rules apply: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk
There are three pegs named left, middle, right
Disks are labeled A through O where A is the smallest and O is the largest
Initial configuration on left peg top to bottom: A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O
Middle peg is empty at start
Right peg is empty at start
Goal configuration: left peg top to bottom: B E F G H I J K L M N O; middle peg top to bottom: A D; right peg top to bottom: C
Agents have movement restrictions: agent_1 may move A B C D E; agent_2 may move F G H I J; agent_3 may move K L M N O

move_sequence.system_prompt: You are agent_1 participating in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi solution. You may only move disks A B C D E. Provide a complete ordered list of primitive moves you will perform. Each move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules and the public information. Do not emit PDDL. If you need to rely on other agents for temporary placements, indicate moves in the correct chronological order so they can be integrated later.
move_sequence.prompt: Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information} Your local goal: {agents->agent_1->goal} Provide the ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, following the specified format and obeying all rules and your movement restrictions.

move_sequence.system_prompt: You are agent_2 participating in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi solution. You may only move disks F G H I J. Provide a complete ordered list of primitive moves you will perform. Each move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules and the public information. Do not emit PDDL. If you need to rely on other agents for temporary placements, indicate moves in the correct chronological order so they can be integrated later.
move_sequence.prompt: Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information} Your local goal: {agents->agent_2->goal} Provide the ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, following the specified format and obeying all rules and your movement restrictions.

move_sequence.system_prompt: You are agent_3 participating in a cooperative Tower of Hanoi solution. You may only move disks K L M N O. Provide a complete ordered list of primitive moves you will perform. Each move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules and the public information. Do not emit PDDL. If you need to rely on other agents for temporary placements, indicate moves in the correct chronological order so they can be integrated later.
move_sequence.prompt: Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private information: {agents->agent_3->private_information} Your local goal: {agents->agent_3->goal} Provide the ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, following the specified format and obeying all rules and your movement restrictions.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive each agent's ordered list of primitive moves. Your task is to integrate these move sequences, resolve any interleaving or temporary placement dependencies, and generate a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownward solver that encodes the multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and the target goal configuration. Keep agent actions distinct in the PDDL (prefix action names or use agent-specific action predicates). Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownward conventions.
pddl.prompt: Public information: {environment->public_information} Agent 1 moves: {moves_agent_1} Agent 2 moves: {moves_agent_2} Agent 3 moves: {moves_agent_3} Your goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Integrate the agents' sequences, resolve ordering conflicts under Tower of Hanoi rules, and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem pair enclosed in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags, targeting the FastDownward planner. Keep actions from different agents distinct in the domain and problem.
